snippet: Though weapons are banned from most public universities, pro-gun forces have made gains on the issue in a handful of states, most recently Colorado.
abstract: American public colleges and universities have become major front in nation's debate as gun-rights advocates press to expand right to carry concealed weapons; though weapons are banned from most public universities, pro-gun forces have made gains on the issue in a handful of states, most recently Colorado; many students remain indifferent.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and SUSAN SAULNY

lead_paragraph: Though weapons are banned from most public universities, pro-gun forces have made gains on the issue in a handful of states, most recently Colorado.

headline.seo: Gun Advocates Push for More Access on Campus
headline.main: Colleges Become Major Front in Fight Over Carrying Guns
headline.print_headline: Gun Advocates Press for More Inroads On Campuses
